Articles.Content:
Easy mode:Go to a suborbital trajectory without time warp!

Normal mode: Go orbit Kerbin once without time warp!

Hard mode: Dock with a space craft without time warp!

Harder mode: Go orbit Kerbin in a geostationary orbit once without time warp!

Hardest mode: Go to the mun and land and return without time warp!

Very hard: Go to a planet or Minmus without time warp!

Points:

Easy:10

Normal:20

Hard:50

Harder:500

Hardest:100000

Very hard:900000000

If you cheat, you've flushed your chance of winning!

Edited April 9, 2014 by Donterrio

How do you count points? Also, Eeloo is very different from the Mun in terms of getting there without time warp. What about PhysWarp? Can we use that?

Also, what are the rules? Can't we just use infinite fuel and an array of mainsails to brute-force this?

E: Okay, so five days from now I'm going to do a trip to Minmus using time warp and then claim I won "very hard".

Edited April 7, 2014 by regex

Hm I just mentally complained that this is not a challenge - only a matter of patience. But then I thought, why not 'solve' it in a crazy way

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Love the KSPI warp drive and 10G ascends

By the current rules this should apply for 'Very hard: Go to a planet or Minmus without time warp!' and I guess you believe me that I didn't need timewarp for a 3:22 min flight.

How to "Hardest Mode!"

1: Launch craft into orbit.

2: Make a cup of tea whilst waiting for Munar burn.

3: Make burn.

4: Go to sleep with alarm set to coincide with Munar landing time.

5: Wake up, suicide burn, and land.

6: Eat breakfast.

7: Do much the same thing on return.

...

Progress!

With all due seriousness, though, this challenge is pretty pointless. It's just an exercise in patience, instead of a real challenge. There is no way to tell whether or not someone is cheating, and going to another planet, even if the game was left on continuously, would likely take longer than it takes to release a new version of KSP.

Sorry, but I think that you should check out the Challenge Submission Guide before posting again.

Welcome to the forum, by the way! I hope you enjoy your stay
Since it wasn't mentioned in the rules, I shall accomplish this via HyperEdit.
Hyperedit does not "go to", it just puts you there, so is not in the spirit of the challenge.
Guys. It's his first post, I think he was trollbaiting. Don't feed him!
Yeah, I've heard of no-warp Mun missions, but seriously, why? Everything works fine with warp anyway and its no harder without warp, just more time-consuming.
